channel.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed
channel.description: im using MTP V2 and the skillcapes have no stat requirement-.- u can wield them @ level 1. please tell me how to fix this and if not then tell me how to make a shop that would show me skillcape only once i achieve 99 in that skill.. like if i get 99 str then str cape becomes available for me in that shop.

item.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed
item.dc:creator: @Runefell Runefell
item.description:
@Runefell wrote:

Sorry about that, I didn’t realize he posted his Base.

Read full topic
item.source: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed

item.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

[quote=“Runefell, post:4, topic:363757”]Not all sources have that class Guru.[/quote]MTP v2 = Emulous-based, Project Insanity server.
Project Insanity uses Player class, (Player.java) located (src/server/model/players/Player.java) to declare the variables.
It then uses the ItemAssistant class, (ItemAssistant.java) located (src/server/model/items/ItemAssistant.java) to append the requirements.

If you guys don’t know what base they are using, please refrain from posting.

Read full topic
item.source: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed

item.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed

item.source: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed

item.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

[quote=“QuestMaster 2K10, post:2, topic:363757”]Stop with the “MPT v2” or other source names because i’m pretty sure the same code can be used for all sources or can be converted.

Find the equipment variable in the playerHanndler.java class. Use an IF statement with that variable requesting it to be equal to the same ID to the skillcape you’re dealing with under the equipment ID the skillcape can be worn on. Then use the skill level variable requesting that it equal 99, or higher, under the correct ID that the skill is for under the skillcape. If it is equal to 99, set the skillcape equiptable. If it doesn’t equal to 99 but lower, then send an error message.[/quote]No.

Declare the level requirement integers in Player class.
Declare the actual requirement in ItemAssistant.

Read full topic
item.source: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed

item.title: MTP V2 skill cape requirements help needed
item.dc:creator: @QuestMaster_2K10 QuestMaster 2K10
item.description:
@QuestMaster_2K10 wrote:

Stop with the “MPT v2” or other source names because i’m pretty sure the same code can be used for all sources or can be converted.

Find the equipment variable in the playerHanndler.java class. Use an IF statement with that variable requesting it to be equal to the same ID to the skillcape you’re dealing with under the equipment ID the skillcape can be worn on. Then use the skill level variable requesting that it equal 99, or higher, under the correct ID that the skill is for under the skillcape. If it is equal to 99, set the skillcape equiptable. If it doesn’t equal to 99 but lower, then send an error message.

Read full topic
